item.title: 三名美国人在中国囚犯交换中获释
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，作为拜登政府与中国政府交换囚犯的一部分，中国释放了三名美国人，这是对手之间罕见的合作时刻。【原文：China released three Americans as part of a prisoner swap between the Biden administration and the Chinese government, according to a person familiar with the matter, a rare moment of cooperation between the adversaries.】

item.title: 土耳其称通胀放缓将减少对里拉的干预
item.description: 据熟悉讨论情况的人士透露，土耳其央行的一位高级官员本周告诉国际投资者，当局预计随着时间的推移将减少对外汇市场的干预。【原文：A senior Turkish central banker told international investors this week that authorities expect to intervene less in the foreign-exchange market over time, according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 美国在指控马杜罗选举舞弊后制裁其更多助手
item.description: 美国制裁了 21 名官员，称他们支持委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗蔑视选举结果的行为。【原文：The US sanctioned 21 officials it said supported Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s effort to defy results of an election that the country’s opposition and Washington say he lost.】

item.title: 肯尼亚计划征收公园入园费资助野生动物保护
item.description: 肯尼亚以标志性的野生动物园而闻名，野生动物园的动物包括角马、大象和狮子，肯尼亚计划对公园、保护区和保护地的门票征收 1%的税，用于野生动物保护。【原文：Kenya, known for iconic safaris featuring animals from wildebeests to elephants and lions, plans to charge a 1% levy on entry fees to parks, reserves and conservancies to fund wildlife conservation.】

item.title: 墨西哥警告特朗普其严厉关税将重创美国经济
item.description: 大量失业和更昂贵的皮卡：据墨西哥政府称，这就是唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对邻国征收的高额关税对美国意味着什么。【原文：Massive job losses and more expensive pickup trucks: That’s what the steep tariffs Donald Trump is threatening to slap on his neighbors will mean for the US, according to Mexico’s government.】

item.title: 维克托-什韦茨：为什么这次真的不同？
item.description:
高度金融化的世界即将发生混乱。【原文：

Disruptions are coming to a highly financialized world.

】

item.title: 美联储青睐的通胀指标回升，支持谨慎态度
item.description: 美联储首选的基础通胀指标在 10 月份比一年前有所加快，这有助于解释政策制定者对降低利率采取的更为谨慎的态度。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s preferred measure of underlying inflation accelerated in October from a year ago, helping explain policymakers’ more cautious approach to lowering interest rates.】

item.title: 美国成屋待完成销售增至 3 月以来最高水平
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率的短暂下降吸引了购房者，10 月份美国成屋待售量意外升至七个月来的最高点。【原文：Pending sales of US homes unexpectedly rose to a seven-month high in October as a brief drop in mortgage rates lured buyers.】

item.title: 津巴布韦顶级食品制造商成为首家从仅限美元交易的交易所退市的公司
item.description: 由于预计无法在短期内筹集到资金，国家食品控股有限公司将把公司私有化，并从津巴布韦维多利亚瀑布证券交易所退市。【原文：National Foods Holdings Ltd. will take the company private and delist from Zimbabwe’s Victoria Falls Stock Exchange, which trades exclusively in US dollars, as it doesn’t foresee raising capital anytime soon.】

item.title: 约翰内斯堡居民与警察因缺水发生骚乱
item.description: 南非经济中心约翰内斯堡的居民在抗议市中心西部地区供水不足时与警方发生冲突。【原文：Residents in South Africa’s economic hub of Johannesburg clashed with police during a protest about a lack of water supply in areas west of the city center.】

item.title: Veritas 寻求降低软件公司 Medallia 的私人贷款风险
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Veritas Capital 正寻求减少其在一笔私人信用贷款中的股份，该贷款为 Thoma Bravo 收购 Medallia Inc.【原文：Veritas Capital is looking to reduce its stake in a private credit loan that financed Thoma Bravo’s buyout of Medallia Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 莫桑比克中央银行将关键利率降至 2020 年以来最低点
item.description: 莫桑比克中央银行将基准贷款利率下调至 2020 年 12 月以来的最低水平，尽管选举后的动乱动摇了这个东南非国家的经济。【原文：Mozambique’s central bank cut its benchmark lending rate to the lowest level since December 2020, despite post-election unrest that has shaken the southeast African nation’s economy.】

item.title: 波兰储备创纪录的谷物以保障粮食供应
item.description: 波兰已将其粮食储备扩大到创纪录的水平，以期在极端天气或地缘政治事件阻碍供应的情况下加强粮食安全。【原文：Poland has expanded its grain stockpile to a record, in a bid to bolster food security if extreme weather or geopolitical events stifle supplies.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔伟大新希望之星陨落，债券涨势受阻
item.description: 厄瓜多尔总统所获得的压倒性支持在该国下届大选前的几个月内逐渐消失，随之消失的还有该国债券的前景。【原文：The overwhelming support Ecuador’s president enjoyed is evaporating just a few months ahead of the country’s next election — and with it, the prospects for the nation’s bonds.】

item.title: 摩根大通因财政风险加剧下调巴西股票评级
item.description: 摩根大通成为一周内第二家下调巴西股票评级的银行，理由是预算赤字激增和利率上升的前景。【原文：JPMorgan became the second bank in just over a week to downgrade its recommendation on Brazilian stocks, citing a burgeoning budget deficit and the prospect of higher interest rates.】

item.title: 南非财政部长表示国家工资提议已达极限
item.description: 南非财政部长表示，在通胀放缓之后，政府无法保证上个月向公务员提出的 4.7% 的工资增幅会进一步提高。【原文：South Africa’s finance minister said the government can’t guarantee a 4.7% wage-increase offer it made to public servants last month will increase further, after inflation slowed.】

item.title: T-Mobile 工程师发现黑客在路由器上运行命令
item.description: T-Mobile US Inc. 网络设备上的可疑行为向该公司提供了漏洞线索，该漏洞可能是一场大范围网络间谍活动的一部分，这引发了关于一个关键经济部门暴露的紧迫问题。【原文：Suspicious behavior on T-Mobile US Inc.’s network devices tipped off the company to a breach that was potentially part of a sprawling cyber-espionage campaign that has raised urgent questions about the exposure of a critical sector of the economy.】

item.title: 迪士尼+、麦克斯在夏季涨价后提供假日折扣
item.description: 黑色星期五不仅仅是服装和电子产品的促销日。流媒体服务也在打折，这可能会帮助消费者避免最近订阅价格的上涨。【原文：Black Friday isn’t just for clothing and electronics deals. Streaming services are on sale, too, and may help customers escape recent increases in subscription prices.】

item.title: 加密 Altcoins 在创纪录的增长中未能跟上比特币的步伐
item.description: 虽然本月在比特币创纪录的涨势中，另类币的资金流入不断增加，但2021年加密货币泡沫的阴影仍笼罩着该行业的大部分企业。【原文：While altcoins have seen increasing inflows this month amid Bitcoin’s record-breaking rally, the shadow of the 2021 crypto bubble still hangs over much of the sector.】

item.title: Altice International 因实验室和外汇问题下调盈利展望
item.description: 由于帕特里克-德拉希（Patrick Drahi）陷入困境的电信帝国部分业务持续恶化，Altice International 下调了今年的盈利展望。【原文：Altice International lowered its earnings outlook for the year as Patrick Drahi’s embattled telecommunications empire continued to see parts of the business deteriorate.】

item.title: 德意志银行完成出售价值 10 亿美元的房地产贷款组合
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）已完成处置近 10 亿美元与美国商业房地产相关的贷款，从而减少了对这一资产类别的风险敞口。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG has completed the disposal of close to $1 billion in loans linked to US commercial real estate, reducing its exposure to an asset class that had weighed on the business.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 Almoosa 筹备王国最新医疗保健 IPO
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的 Almoosa 公司公布了首次公开募股计划，这是沙特阿拉伯一系列医疗保健上市计划中最新的一项。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Almoosa unveiled plans for an initial public offering, the latest in a series of health-care listings in the kingdom.】

item.title: 受消费支出拉动，美国国内生产总值稳健增长 2.8
item.description: 美国经济在第三季度稳健增长，主要得益于消费者支出的广泛增长，而通胀则继续降温。【原文：The US economy expanded at a solid pace in the third quarter, largely powered by a broad-based advance in consumer spending as inflation continued to cool.】

item.title: 瑞银集团在瑞士信贷洗钱刑事案件中被判无罪
item.description: 瑞士信贷银行 2022 年因未能阻止为可卡因毒贩的利润洗钱而被定罪，但瑞士上诉法院在该案中一名被判有罪的前雇员死亡后推翻了这一定罪。【原文：Credit Suisse’s 2022 conviction for failing to prevent the money laundering of a cocaine dealer’s profits was overturned by a Swiss appeals court following the death of one of its former employees who was found guilty in the case.】

item.title: 交易泰斗唐-威尔逊（Don Wilson）说，是时候摆脱证交会了
item.description: 在与美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）和美国商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）旷日持久的斗争之后，全球最大交易公司之一的负责人表示，是时候重新思考整个美国证券行业的监管框架了。【原文：After protracted battles with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, the head of one of the world’s biggest trading firms says its time to rethink the entire US securities industry regulatory framework.】

item.title: 软银支持的 Symbotic 因会计错误影响前景而下挫
item.description: Symbotic Inc. 周三股价暴跌达 39%，此前这家仓库自动化公司下调了第一季度营收预期，并表示由于会计错误无法提交年度文件。【原文：Symbotic Inc. shares tumbled as much as 39% on Wednesday after the warehouse automation company cut its first-quarter revenue forecast and said it was unable to file its annual filing due to accounting errors.】

item.title: Grifols 交易失败，银行错失 2.2 亿欧元债务费
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）表示放弃将制药商 Grifols 私有化的竞标后，银行将损失约 2.2 亿欧元（2.32 亿美元）的承销费。【原文：Banks are losing out on about €220 million ($232 million) in underwriting fees after Brookfield Asset Management said it was abandoning its bid to take drug-maker Grifols private.】

item.title: 电池制造商莫罗要求挪威就贷款的成败作出裁决
item.description: 挪威莫罗电池公司（Morrow Batteries AS）正面临着生存危机，因为该公司正等待政府资金的批准，而政府资金对于吸引投资者至关重要。【原文：Norway’s Morrow Batteries AS is facing an existential crisis as it awaits approval of government funds vital to attracting investors in an industry scarred by the collapse of Swedish startup Northvolt AB.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德撤回 68 亿美元收购制药商 Grifols 的要约
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.）放弃了收购 Grifols SA 的计划，结束了数月来关于收购这家西班牙血浆公司的谈判。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. walked away from a plan to acquire Grifols SA, ending months of negotiations to take over the Spanish blood-plasma company.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气买家急于寻找美国制裁的变通办法
item.description:
欧洲从俄罗斯获取天然气并支付费用的方式正在发生变化。【原文：

The tectonic plates of how Europe gets and pays for gas from Russia are moving.

】
